title: BBC Local Live: Cumbria for Thursday 12 October 2017 - BBC News
summary: mobile crane fire blocks m6 as tyres explode .
county cleans up after downpour floods homes and roads .
bridges stay shut as engineers check for downpour damage .
'chennai six ' campaigners hand in petition at downing street .

documents.title: mps urged to help britons jailed in india
text: mps urged to help britons jailed in india

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 've now finished posting news , travel reports and a regular weather forecast , on a day dominated by two stories ; here 's a reminder :
we 'll be back to do it all again from 08:00 tomorrow .

in the meantime , if you want to pass on news you think we should know , or share a photo ( maybe of renewed flooding ) , you can email them to us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .
have a very good evening .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: £ 755,000 grant to recruit overseas gps for north cumbria
text: north cumbria is one of three areas in england to win a £ 755,000 grant to recruit family doctors from overseas .
it 's part of a pilot scheme to bring in doctors from overseas for training before they can work independently in the uk .
they 'll be recruited for placements of 6-12 months to take part in scheme which is also recruiting uk doctors to go into general practice .

documents.title: do n't drown , turn around , as they say in the usa
text: with another warning of heavy rain and road flooding for tomorrow , take a look at this taken at forge bridge in eskdale during the floods there .
this car is actually afloat , according to alexander knott , who was kind enough to send it in to us .
it 's a salutary reminder that it does n't take a lot of water to wash a car away .
a crew from cumbria fire and rescue helped a driver whose car was being washed down a river at egremont yesterday , and in the usa , the majority of people who die in floods , die in cars .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: wind warning as former hurricane ophelia sweeps across atlantic
text: a second weather warning 's been posted for cumbria , this time for gales on monday , as a former hurricane spins up the west coast of the british isles .
the weather system formerly known as ophelia is forecast to drop from hurricane to tro force winds , similar to a force 10 atlantic gale , when it arrives off the west of ireland .
in cumbria , the met office says winds could gust widely to 60mph , with 70mph to 80mph in exposed areas .

documents.title: windermere rises again at national trust lakeside centre
text: less than a week after a grant of £ 648,000 was announced to help move national trust buildings to higher ground on the lakeside attraction of fell foot park , windermere has been proving just why it was necessary :
due to the heavy rain yesterday , our shop has had to remain closed today due to flooding .
boathouse cafe open for drinks and snacks
yet again presses the case for the new build up the hill on the site of the big house ?
ahh the night of the flood i remember .
good luck with it all

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : turning windy and very wet again
text: it 'll be cloudy and windy tonight with outbreaks of rain , turning heavy and persistent over the hills .
drier with a few clear spells further east .
lows of 12c ( 54f ) .
there 's a yellow warning of rain , which could cause local flooding on roads and possibly property .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , and details of the weather warning , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: pictured : how tyres turned into bouncing bombs on the m6
text: i tramped across country today to cover the story of the blazing crane on the m6 , and captured this photograph showing the footprints of one of its tyres , blown off the motorway and cartwheeling across a field as it exploded in the heat .

the m6 will be closed northbound again at 22:00 tonight while the company that crane belonged to , ainscough , sends in two more cranes to recover the wreckage , and for the damaged road surface to be repaired .
it 's expected to reopen at 06:00 .
author: John Bowness
BBC Radio Cumbria reporter

documents.title: police find 'noises ' caller is on wanted list himself
text: police in barrow who responded to a call about sus noises on a roof found they were being caused by pigeons .
but apparently their journey was not entirely wasted , as the details of the caller corresponded to a warrant out for a breach of a community order .
male reported intruders on his roof at egerton court .
officers found it was only pigeons !
complainant then arrested for warrant .
# birdbrain
he must live on pigeon street
some days you 're the pigeon , some days you 're the statue .
who was today 's statue ?
# dope
i guess thats called an `` own goal '' .

documents.title: what 's small , white and fluffy , and lives on walney ?
text: struggling across the cobbles , the first seal pup of the winter explores his new world on the south walney nature reserve .
it 's the third year running that the animals have given birth at the cumbria wildlife trust reserve confirming it as a breeding place for seals .
the arrival of the breeding season is expected to see more people visiting walney - although cumbria wildlife trust wardens warn that pups should not be disturbed .
you can watch the seals here .

documents.title: dave from workington hoists britain 's best-known bridge
text: tower bridge in london must be one of britain 's best known bridges , and as it opens to let boats sail up and down the thames , it may well be dave wilson from workington who 's pressing the buttons .
it 's the ultimate toy - brilliant . ''
author: Belinda Artingstoll
BBC Cumbria Live

documents.title: new heavy rain and flood warning posted for county
text: the met office has just posted a yellow warning of rain for tomorrow , starting at 03:00 .
the forecasters say up to 50mm ( 2in ) is expected quite widely , with up to 80mm ( 3in ) on higher ground .
the warning says that after recent rain , flooding on roads is probable and flooding of some homes and businesses is also possible .

documents.title: school appeals after vandals set fires
text: staff at kingmoor junior school in carlisle say it 's been hit by a series of incidents of vandalism .
children have been seen climbing on the roof , and equipment in the grounds has been set on fire .
a spokesman for the school said the youngsters seen on the roof , particularly on saturday nights , were putting themselves in danger .
we have taken great pains to try to prevent unauthorised access to the roof of our building as it is fragile and contains numerous skylights . ''

documents.title: academy 'chain ' takes in two more schools
text: the cumbria academy trust has taken in two primary schools and says it 's now one of the county 's largest chains .
academies are funded directly from the government and are independent of local council control .

the newly-added members are tebay and yanwath primaries ; the trust already oversaw yewdale primary in carlisle , and longtown , as well as william howard secondary school in brampton and workington academy .

documents.title: m6 to be closed again as burned-out crane is recovered
text: police say the m6 northbound will have to close again for a time later as the wreckage of a 110-tonne crane is recovered and the road surface repaired .
there was major disruption earlier as tyres on the large vehicle exploded in the heat , blowing blazing rubber across both carriageways between junctions 36 and 37 .
later this afternoon and probably into the evening evening there will be a massive recovery in place . ''
author: John Bowness
BBC Radio Cumbria reporter

documents.title: four bridges being checked after floods
text: cumbria highways engineers say they 're keeping four bridges closed while they 're checked for damage after yesterday 's floods .
they include the a595 at holmrook bridge , kersey bridge south of st bees on the b5345 , the forge at eskdale , and egremont bridge .
there 's a page on the county council website showing the latest position .

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : fine and breezy
text: it will stay fine this afternoon with a mixture of sunny spells and some fair weather cloud .
it will be breezy , perhaps turning windy around irish sea coasts later with the chance of some rain .
temperatures will be about 14 c ( 57f ) .
you can find the latest weather forecast for where you are , and details of a yellow warning for rain tomorrow , here .
and while we 're on the subject of the weather
nice day , glorious view , but hellfire it 's wet underfoot , never ever seen it so bad whilst we still have cattle out .
it 's hellish !
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : m6 reopens southbound , and one lane northbound
text: police say the southbound carriageway of the m6 , closed earlier after a crane caught fire , is now reopened .
one lane on the northbound side has also now reopened .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: inspectors give hospitals all-clear on feeding tubes
text: inspectors say staff at hospitals in north and west cumbria are now handling nasogastric tubes , which are used to put food directly into the digestive systems of seriously-ill patients , safely .
however it needs to improve the insertion record for patient care plans , and develop a policy around the use of the tubes for pregnant women .
the care quality commission was asked to look into the way staff handled the tubes , training , and other matters , after an inquest into two deaths at hospitals in whitehaven and carlisle .
a report published today says staff follow the best practice , and there have been no serious incidents since april 2015 .
the work does not stop here and all of our staff are committed to continuing to make further improvements in safety for our patients . ''

documents.title: blazing crane closes motorway
text: blazing crane closes motorway

documents.title: m6 'may be damaged by crane blaze '
text: engineers are going to inspect the northbound carriageway of the m6 near kendal after a crane caught fire and blazed fiercely for more than an hour .
anne rothwell , who was caught in the queue , said : `` every time they try to quell the flames it seems to puff up again .
the family next to me are going on holiday and will miss their flight . ''
the motorway has now reopened southbound , and traffic going north is being released along one lane , but no new traffic is being allowed past junction 36 .
the carriageways will need to be inspected for damage after the fire and may need repairs , so officers do not expect the northbound side to reopen soon .

documents.title: weather on the fell tops : cold and windy
text: temperatures at 3,000ft : 3c .
winds : strong westerly , gusts 40mph , backing southerly by evening , gusts 50mph .
cloud : patchy cloud around 2,500ft , becoming more widespread down to 1,600ft by evening .
visibility : good , falling moderate in rain or drizzle later and poor in hill fog .

documents.title: cumbria cleans up after downpour floods roads and homes
text: people in the county are clearing up after flooding closed roads and inundated homes yesterday .
high fells recorded 8in of rain , and 2in fell widely within a few hours .
a number of roads are still affected this morning ; cumbria county council has listed those it says are still impassable here .
homes were flooded in egremont , frizington and lamplugh , according to cumbria fire and rescue .

meanwhile , cumbria community foundation has started paying emergency flood grants to some of the 350 householders whose homes were flooded two weeks ago in millom , but staff there say the fund has only £ 50,000 , so grants are being focused on people on low incomes .
so far 69 people have applied to the find that have been flooded in millom , and we have awarded grants to about 19 people , and we are assessing the others . ''

documents.title: photo shows crane on fire which has closed m6
text: the m6 is closed in both directions after this crane caught fire , with its tyres exploding and throwing debris across both carriageways .
long delays have built up in both directions and traffic is being diverted through kendal .
police say they do n't expect the northbound carriageway to be reopened until much later this morning .
nb & sb likely to be closed for a while whilst fire , police and highways deal .
will update with more info shortly .
hope driver ok
yes thankfully .
it 's my cousin 's hubby .
very lucky .

think it is m6 j36-j37

documents.title: 'chennai six ' campaigners hand in petition to downing street
text: the campaign to free six former british soldiers being held in india will be taken to downing street today .
the six , including john armstrong from wigton , were found guilty of weapons offences while working on an anti-piracy ship .
the men have always denied the charges , and today , four years since his arrest , mr armstrong 's sister joanne thomlinson is going to downing street to hand in a 400,000-signature petition .

documents.title: travel : m6 closure causes jams in kendal
text: the closure of the m6 is now causing congestion in kendal , particularly on the a591 and a6 through to lound road .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : a chilly start , then a fine day
text: a chilly start will be followed by a fine day with a mixture of sunny spells and some fair weather cloud .
temperatures will be heading towards 14c ( 57f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: breakingtravel : m6 closed both ways by fire
text: cumbria police now say the m6 is closed both ways between junctions 36 , kendal , and 37 , sedbergh because a crane is on fire in lane two of the northbound carriageway .
tyres are exploding , throwing rubber on to the southbound carriageway .
police say they hope to reopen the southbound carriageway soon , but the northbound will need repairs and will be closed until at least mid-morning .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: travel : crane fire blocks m6 in south cumbria
text: the m6 is closed northbound between junctions 36 and 37 , for kendal and sedbergh , because a crane is on fire .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: good morning and welcome to bbc cumbria live
text: we 'll be keeping up with the news and travel reports , posting a regular weather forecast and dropping in the odd other nugget from the county through until about 18:00 .
as always , if you want to pass on news you think we should know , or share a photo , you can email them to us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter
